description: Two storey side extension for use as a 3 bedroom dwellinghouse, following demolition of existing garage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with submitted drawings / documentation, specifically being Proposed Ground Floor & First Floor Plan, Drawing Number SO-745-04 Revision A, dated July 2016; Proposed Front Elevation, Drawing Number SO-745-05, dated July 2016; Proposed Rear Elevation, Drawing Number SO-745-06 Revision A, dated July 2016; Proposed Side Elevation, Drawing Number SO-745-07 Revision A, dated July 2016; Proposed Site Plan, Drawing Number SO-745-08 Revision B, dated July 2016; 260 Windmill Lane, Ealing W5 4DL - Design and Access Statement, prepared by Chalkline Architectural Services, dated 10/10/2016
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials shall be in accordance with the materials described in the Application Form and the Approved Plans as listed in Condition 2 of this decision.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (g) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4, 7.6 of the London Plan - Consolidated (2015)

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 and Class B of Part 2 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorized by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

REASON: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| Cycle storage with minimum dimensions of 1.2m x 2m, for a minimum of two (2) bicycles shall be provided onsite in accordance with the plans approved under Condition 2 of this Decision, and all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and refuse, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 5.16, 6.9 and 7.5 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).

| Prior to the development hereby permitted being first occupied, all windows at first floor level of the side facing elevation (as demonstrated on approved proposal plan Drawing Number SO-745-07 Revision A, dated July 2016) shall be glazed with obscured glass, and this glazing shall be maintained for the life of the development.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building as indicated on the approved plans and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).
